private_information: I am allowed to move disks A B C D E
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move only one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is left peg top-to-bottom: B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom: A, C, D

private_information: I am allowed to move disks F G H I J
I must follow Tower of Hanoi rules: move only one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that the final configuration is left peg top-to-bottom: B, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg empty; right peg top-to-bottom: A, C, D

private_information: I must produce a combined PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver that represents the cooperative multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the moves and constraints from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward that captures agent action distinctions and achieves the global goal configuration

public_information: This is a cooperative two agent Tower of Hanoi problem with three pegs named left middle right and ten disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J where A is the smallest and J the largest
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg empty
Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg top-to-bottom A C D
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move disks A B C D E. Agent_2 may move disks F G H I J
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: one disk moved at a time and no larger disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You may only move disks A B C D E. Using the public initial and goal configurations and following Tower of Hanoi rules, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each line must follow the exact format: agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. Use peg names left middle right. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only the sequence of moves and nothing else.

You are agent_2. You may only move disks F G H I J. Using the public initial and goal configurations and following Tower of Hanoi rules, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each line must follow the exact format: agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ. Use peg names left middle right. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only the sequence of moves and nothing else.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an orchestrator expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL for FastDownward. Receive the ordered primitive moves from agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate them into a coherent PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. You must keep agent actions distinct using separate action names or agent predicates so the final model preserves which agent performs each move. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL captures disk sizes order, peg states, agent movement permissions, initial configuration, and the final goal configuration. Do not include extra commentary outside the domain and problem tags.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator integrate the following information: Public environment information: This is a cooperative two agent Tower of Hanoi problem with three pegs named left middle right and ten disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J where A is the smallest and J the largest. Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg empty. Goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom B E F G H I J, middle peg empty, right peg top-to-bottom A C D. Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move disks A B C D E. Agent_2 may move disks F G H I J. Here are the moves produced by agent_1: {moves_agent_1} Here are the moves produced by agent_2: {moves_agent_2} Using these moves as the authoritative primitive move sequence, produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward that represents the agents distinct actions and the initial and goal states. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
